meanings.definition: Ysame (adjective): having the same characteristics or qualities
meanings.sent1: The two flowers look ysame with their bright colors.
meanings.sent2: The twins have ysame smiles that light up the room.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how the two dogs seem ysame with their wagging tails.
meanings.sent4: The two mountains stood ysame, towering over the valley.
meanings.sent5: The ysame patterns on the wallpaper made the room feel cozy.

meanings.definition: Ysame (noun): a person or thing that is identical or similar to another
meanings.sent1: She found a ysame in the crowd who shared her love for books.
meanings.sent2: The two cars parked side by side were ysame in color.
meanings.sent3: The ysame of the two paintings made it hard to tell them apart.
meanings.sent4: The ysame of the two keys confused him as to which one to use.
meanings.sent5: The ysame of their voices made it difficult to distinguish who was speaking.

meanings.definition: Ysame (verb): to be alike or equivalent in some way
meanings.sent1: The two recipes ysame in their use of spices.
meanings.sent2: Their opinions ysame on the best movie of the year.
meanings.sent3: The two friends always seem to ysame in their taste in music.
meanings.sent4: The colors of their outfits ysame perfectly for the party.
meanings.sent5: The two paths ysame, leading to the same beautiful view.
